Description:
Prohibition Notice served,

Use of hand held emery abrasive cloth on manual lathes


Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to take effective measures to prevent access to dangerous parts of the machinery, namely the rotating chuck and tool of the Chester vertical milling machine (serial number 057N).

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that the local exhaust ventilation system on the induction annealer, provided to prevent or control exposure to substances which are hazardous to health, namely welding fume, has been thoroughly examined and tested by a competent person in the last 14 months.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that the exposure of your employees to substances hazardous to health, namely welding fume, which is a known carcinogen, is either prevented or, where this is not reasonably practicable, adequately controlled.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to make a suitable and sufficient assessment of the risk created by work which exposes your employees to vibration and identify measures that need to be taken to reduce their exposure to vibration.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to carry out a suitable and sufficient assessment of the risks to your employees and those not in your employment, but who are affected by the conduct of your undertaking in relation to legionella. There are risk factors present that mean that your hot and cold water system and the use of the adiabatic cooler require assessment to identify the required level of control.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that where employees have been provided with tight-fitting respiratory protective equipment to control their exposure to substances hazardous to health, such as magnesium oxide, they have been face-fit tested to ensure the equipment is suitable to adequately control their exposure.

Improvement Notice served,

You have failed to ensure that workers liable to be exposed to substances hazardous to health, namely metalworking fluid (a respiratory sensitiser and cause of dermatitis) and stainless steel welding fume (a respiratory sensitiser) are under suitable health surveillance.
